summary.para: Lists modes which determine how an appointment fits in the time cell when dragging or resizing.
Appointment moves smoothly, its Start and End borders are moved pixel by pixel which enables the end-user to set the time interval precisely.
Appointment Start and End borders are snapped to time cells which forces the end-user to set the time interval round to the nearest value determined by the property.

Lists values that specify whether the user can scroll the scheduler’s view area by dragging an appointment to the viewport’s border.
Scroll by dragging an appointment is disabled.
The user can scroll both the time and resources by dragging an appointment.
The user can scroll resources by dragging an appointment.
The user can scroll the time by dragging an appointment.
Lists the fit modes of appointment in the time cell(s) by stretching it to the cell’s boundaries.
An appointment is always stretched to cell borders so that it occupies the entire cell or several cells.
Appointment is stretched to a cell border only if the appointment start and end are located in the same cell or in adjacent cells.

The appointment visible width is proportional to its duration. However, there is a minimal visible width () or height (). If an appointment’s duration is quite small, it will never be narrower than the minimal value.
